Technical Documentation¶

The Calculations Package¶

calculations:¶

Package calculations.

The package provides functionality for computing the Euclidean algorithm.

MODULES:

calc_functions.py: Сontains functions for calculations.

USAGE:

import calculations

calc_functions.py:¶

This module provides functions for calculating the greatest common divisor of two integers using a modified version of the Euclidean algorithm.

FUNCTIONS:

get_gcd_multiplier(a_number: int, b_number: int) -> int: Calculates the multiplier needed in the Euclidean algorithm.

get_gcd(a_number: int, b_number: int) -> int: Computes the GCD of two integers.

Example

from calculations import get_gcd

print(get_gcd(30, 18))

# Output: 6

calc_functions.get_gcd(a_number: int, b_number: int) → int[source]¶

Calculate the greatest common divisor of two integers.

This function uses a modified version of the Euclidean algorithm to compute the GCD of two integers by repeatedly reducing the larger integer until it equals zero.

Parameters:

  • a_number (int) – The first integer.

  • b_number (int) – The second integer.

Returns:

The greatest common divisor of the two integers.

Return type:

int

Example

print(get_gcd(30, 18))

# Output: 6

calc_functions.get_gcd_multiplier(a_number: int, b_number: int) → int[source]¶

Calculates the multiplier in the Euclidean algorithm.

The function determines the multiplier needed to express the difference between the maximum and minimum of the two integers in terms of the minimum integer.

Parameters:

  • a_number (int) – The first integer.

  • b_number (int) – The second integer.

Returns:

The multiplier for the smaller number of a pair of numbers of the Euclid algorithm, when multiplied by which the difference between the larger number of a pair of numbers of the Euclid algorithm and the product will be less than the smaller number of a pair of numbers of the Euclid algorithm.

Return type:

int

Example

print(get_gcd_multiplier(30, 18))

# Output: 1

The GUI Package¶

graphical_user_interface:¶

Package graphical_user_interface.

The package provides a graphical function for working with the Euclid algorithm.

MODULES:

gui_data.py: Contains the data necessary for the functions.

gui_functions.py: Сontains functions for visualizations of the application.

USAGE:

from graphical_user_interface import draw_main_window

gui_data.py:¶

This module contains configuration settings and constants for the application.

CONSTANTS:

BACKGROUND_PATH (str): The file path to the background image used in the application.

Example

from graphical_user_interface import BACKGROUND_PATH

background_image = load_image(BACKGROUND_PATH)

gui_functions.py:¶

The Start Point¶

main.py:¶

Main entry point for the GCD calculation application.

This script initializes and launches the graphical user interface for calculating the greatest common divisor of two integers. It imports necessary functions from the calculations and graphical_user_interface modules.

DESCRIPTION:

Run this script to display the main application window where users can input two integers and calculate their GCD. The window dimensions can be specified as arguments to the draw_window function.

USAGE:

poetry run python src/main.py

The Test Functions¶

test_get_gcd.py:¶

Test module for the get_gcd_multiplier function from the calculations module.

This module contains unit tests for the get_gcd_multiplier function, which calculates the multiplier. The tests are designed to validate the correctness of the function across various input scenarios.

FUNCTIONS:

test_get_gcd_multiplier(a_number: int, b_number: int, result: int) -> None: Run tests for get_gcd_multiplier function.

USAGE:

pytest test_get_gcd_multiplier.py

TEST CASES: - (1, 1) should return 1 - (999, 3) should return 332 - (1071, 462) should return 2 - (1337, 228) should return 5 - (123654789, 7) should return 17664969

test_get_gcd.test_get_gcd_multiplier(a_number: int, b_number: int, result: int) → None[source]¶

Test the get_gcd_multiplier function for correctness.

This function asserts that the output of get_gcd_multiplier for given inputs a_number and b_number matches the expected result.

Parameters:

  • a_number (int) – The first integer input for the GCD calculation.

  • b_number (int) – The second integer input for the GCD calculation.

  • result (int) – The expected output from the get_gcd_multiplier function for the given inputs.

Raises:

AssertionError – If the actual output from get_gcd_multiplier does not equal the expected result.

test_get_gcd_multiplier.py:¶

Test module for the get_gcd function from the calculations module.

This module contains unit tests for the get_gcd function, which calculates the greatest common divisor of two integers. The tests are designed to validate the correctness of the function across various input scenarios.

FUNCTIONS:

test_get_gcd(a_number: int, b_number: int, result: int) -> None: Run tests for get_gcd function.

USAGE:

pytest test_get_gcd.py

TEST CASES: - (1, 1) should return 1 - (999, 3) should return 3 - (1337, 228) should return 1 - (1071, 462) should return 21 - (123654789, 7) should return 1

test_get_gcd_multiplier.test_get_gcd(a_number: int, b_number: int, result: int) → None[source]¶

Test the get_gcd function for correctness.

This function asserts that the output of get_gcd for given inputs a_number and b_number matches the expected result.

Parameters:

  • a_number (int) – The first integer input for the GCD calculation.

  • b_number (int) – The second integer input for the GCD calculation.

  • result (int) – The expected output from the get_gcd function for the given inputs.

Raises:

AssertionError – If the actual output from get_gcd does not equal the expected result.

The Test Data¶

test_data.py:¶

This module contains configuration settings and constants for the tests.

CONSTANTS:

CALCULATIONS_PACKAGE_PATH (str): The calculations package path.

Example

from test_data import CALCULATIONS_PACKAGE_PATH
